text:
Right now, it is a phenomenal
time to be in medicine.

Some of the most complex,
challenging diseases

known to humankind finally
have a chance of being cured.

In particular, a novel
class of molecules

called biologics,
which includes drugs

like antibodies
or COVID vaccines,

have been unlocking entirely
new era of treatments.

Now, unfortunately, unlike
small classic molecule drugs

long-favored by pharma, the
production of these biologics
is very hard.

Because of this, the access
to these life-saving molecules
has been anything but equitable.

Why is it so hard
to make biologics?

You can only make
them using cells

grown in water-based
media, and those cells
need many nutrients to survive.

But the most important
nutrient they need is oxygen,

and that's a really big
problem because water is really

bad at transporting
oxygen. Enter

our game-changing technology,
microporous water,

featured on the cover
of Nature magazine

and for which we have
a patent pending.

Our technology increases the
amount of oxygen in water

by up to 7,000%, allowing
us to now grow cells faster,

to higher densities, and
to make more product.

Not only is this
scientifically interesting,

there's also huge commercial
opportunities behind this.

Our initial beachhead
market alone is $15 billion,
growing even more in the future.

Thank you very much,
and we hope all of you

will join our quest to make
antibodies for everyone.
Thank you.
